item.title: ROUGHNESS
item.description: TRUE SCRIPTING EFFECT Roughness effect gives an authentic handwritten finish. A cleaner outline and smaller character set is also available. See the font in action here.

item.title: RICH VARIANTS
item.description: A balance between regularisation and randomness when creating alternative characters. As you type a letter, each one of the three variants appears in an order that avoids repetition of the same shape, making it appear random.

item.title: Multi-lingual
item.description: The addition of diacritical characters to cover Latin alphabets means it‚Äôs ready to take on broader challenges. See the full demo here.

item.title: Type School Diary
item.description: credit: all content and images belong to typeschool and 3type #TypeSchool by @3type_cn - DAY ONE - wrote some calligraphy, watched some Hamilton [sic], traced some roman letters, wasted some food. - DAY TWO - quick type sketches, critiques, fake Japanese food, then we hugged good bye to adorkable Toshi. - DAY THREE - more calligraphy, more quick sketches, more type knowledge, getting more serious ü§î - DAY FOUR - latin is not enough.

item.title: About
item.description: I’ve always been obsessed with people’s hand writing. Reading their writings is like deciphering their thoughts and sentiments. After learning about how Toshi Omagari made Sir Quentin Blake typeface, which is described “…doesn‚Äôt just look like his writing, it acts like it too “, it immediately struck me by the gerund of my friend Hehe’s journal as it gave me a sense of tender & vigour. I spent my last three days making this typeface, and here it is!

item.title: Contact
item.description: If you want to use this font, you can access it via here. Currently this font is still under development. I plan to expand its character set and refine its details. If you have any suggestions or requests , you are welcome drop me an email. I should be able to reply every evening =)
